dt: {bc}a gallery in a church or hall
{bc}one of the upper floors of a warehouse or business building especially when not partitioned
{bc}the backward slant of the face of a golf-club head
{bc}the thickness of a fabric or insulating material (such as goose down)

et: Middle English, from Old English, air, sky, from Old Norse {it}lopt{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}luft{/it} air
shortdef: an upper room or floor : attic
a gallery in a church or hall
one of the upper floors of a warehouse or business building especially when not partitioned

dt: {bc}to place, house, or store in a loft
{bc}to propel through the air or into space
{bc}to lay out a full-sized working drawing of the lines and contours of (such as a ship's hull)
{bc}to propel a ball high into the air

shortdef: to place, house, or store in a loft
to propel through the air or into space
to lay out a full-sized working drawing of the lines and contours of (such as a ship's hull)

dt: {bc}a gallery occupied by a church choir

shortdef: a gallery occupied by a church choir
